basics.name: Yuanhao Zhong
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: As an AI enthusiast, I am passionate about exploring emerging technologies and staying engaged with the latest advancements.

volunteer.organization: Guangzhou Lingxi Interactive Entertainment Co., Ltd.
volunteer.position: Algorithm Intern in Technology Middle Platform
volunteer.summary: Designed, implemented, and optimized algorithms for analyzing user data anomalies. Participated in building and optimizing an advertising revenue prediction model.
highlights: Utilized SQL for efficient data querying, combined with Python and Excel for data cleaning, processing, and visualization. Developed a user activity evaluation system that covered key metrics such as login-to-registration ratio, exposure, conversion rate, and spending, enabling precise identification of system and business anomalies.

Engaged in the entire process from data selection and feature engineering to algorithm modeling and report writing. By comparing various models, selected the XGBoost model, successfully improving the F1-score on the validation set to 0.73, providing strong support for advertising strategy decisions.

education.institution: Beijing Institute of Technology, Beijing, China

awards.title: National scholarship
awards.awarder: Ministry of Education of the People's Republic of China
awards.summary: The National Scholarship, China's highest academic honor, recognizes students for outstanding achievements in academics, research, and social contributions, inspiring excellence and societal progress.

awards.title: First class scholarship of Beijing Institute of Technology
First Prize in the National Mathematical Modeling Competition

certificates.name: CET-6

publications.name: Doctopus: A System for Budget-aware Structural Data Extraction from Unstructured Documents
publications.publisher: Yuanhao Zhong, Yuhao Deng, Chengliang Chai, Ruixin Gu, Ye Yuan, Guoren Wang, Lei Cao
publications.summary: Extracting structured data (e.g., attributes) from unstructured documents is essential for applications like analytical SQL queries and decision-making. To best trade off quality and cost, we present Doctopus, a system designed for accurate and cost-effective attribute extraction.

publications.name: QUEST: A Database for Unstructured Document Analysis.
publications.publisher: Zequn Li, Yuanhao Zhong, Chengliang Chai, Yuhao Deng, Guoren Wang, Lei Cao
publications.summary: In the second paper, he applied the quantum theory to light to explain the photoelectric effect. In particular, he used the idea of light quanta (photons) to explain experimental results, but stressed the importance of the experimental results. The importance of his work on the photoelectric effect earned him the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1921.

references.name: Professor Chengliang Chai
references.reference: Chai Chengliang is a tenure-track associate professor (Special Researcher) and Ph.D. supervisor at the School of Computer Science, Beijing Institute of Technology. He is a recipient of the CCF Outstanding Doctoral Dissertation Award.

projects.name: Doctopus
projects.summary: Designed and implemented an efficient data extraction framework that integrates index construction, quality assessment, and dynamic selection strategies to achieve efficient unstructured data extraction under budget constraints.
highlights: Maximized data extraction accuracy within the budget by dynamically selecting attribute extraction schemes, such as OpenIE, PZ, Lotus, and other large models.
Introduced regression testing and GitHub Actions for continuous integration, adopting a standard workflow for development and issue resolution.

Independently responsible for project documentation, algorithm design, front-end and back-end development, as well as report and video production. The project was accepted by the SIGMOD 2025 Conference.

projects.name: CLUE
projects.summary: Applied Transformer models such as BERT, RoBERTa, and GPT for sentiment analysis tasks.
highlights: Utilized deep generative models like GPT and T5 for literary language style transformation and generation.
Integrated knowledge graphs to assist in the comprehension of classical literary texts.
Conducted a comprehensive evaluation of the model's capability in literary language understanding across multiple dimensions, ultimately achieving a top 10 ranking in the evaluation.
